title: Provides for the training, examination and certification of dog control officers
summary: Provides for the training, examination and certification of dog control officers.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          369

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. HOYT, BARRON, COOK, MAYERSOHN -- Multi-Sponsored
         by -- M. of A.  BRENNAN, JEFFRIES, PHEFFER, SCHIMEL -- read  once  and
         referred to the Committee on Agriculture

       AN  ACT  to amend the agriculture and markets law, in relation to train-
         ing, examination and certification of dog control officers

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. The agriculture and markets law is amended by adding a new
    2  section 114-a to read as follows:
    3    S 114-A. TRAINING AND CERTIFICATION OF DOG CONTROL OFFICERS. 1.    THE
    4  DEPARTMENT  SHALL  DEVELOP  A  TRAINING,  EXAMINATION  AND CERTIFICATION
    5  PROGRAM FOR DOG CONTROL OFFICERS, POLICE OFFICERS AND PEACE OFFICERS WHO
    6  DEAL WITH ANIMAL CONTROL OR ANIMAL ABUSE ISSUES.
    7    2. (A) EXCEPT AS IS PROVIDED IN PARAGRAPH (B) OF THIS SUBDIVISION, ANY
    8  PERSON APPOINTED AS A DOG CONTROL OFFICER SHALL, BEFORE  APPOINTMENT  OR
    9  WITHIN  ONE  YEAR  THEREAFTER, COMPLETE A COURSE OF TRAINING APPROVED BY
   10  THE DEPARTMENT AND SHALL TAKE AND  PASS  AN  EXAMINATION  GIVEN  BY  THE
   11  DEPARTMENT. ANY PERSON CURRENTLY EMPLOYED AS A DOG CONTROL OFFICER SHALL
   12  COMPLETE  THE  TRAINING  AND TAKE AND PASS THE EXAMINATION NO LATER THAN
   13  DECEMBER FIRST, TWO THOUSAND  ELEVEN.  THE  TRAINING  AND  CERTIFICATION
   14  SHALL  BE  AVAILABLE  TO,  BUT NOT REQUIRED FOR POLICE OFFICERS OR PEACE
   15  OFFICERS WHO DEAL WITH ANIMAL CONTROL OR ANIMAL ABUSE ISSUES.
   16    (B)  A  VETERINARIAN  LICENSED  PURSUANT  TO   ARTICLE   ONE   HUNDRED
   17  THIRTY-FIVE  OF  THE  EDUCATION  LAW  SHALL  BE EXEMPT FROM THE TRAINING
   18  REQUIRED BY SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION.
   19    3. THE TRAINING PROGRAM REQUIRED BY THIS SECTION SHALL INCLUDE  TRAIN-
   20  ING REGARDING:
   21    (A) THE SCOPE OF THE RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE DOG CONTROL OFFICER;

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01150-01-1

       A. 369                              2

    1    (B) APPROPRIATE AND HUMANE HANDLING OF ANIMALS, INCLUDING TRANSPORTING
    2  ANIMALS  SAFELY, GENERAL ANIMAL CONTROL AND PROPER METHODS FOR CAPTURING
    3  ANIMALS;
    4    (C)  THE  LAWS  AND  RULES  REGARDING  DOG  LICENSING,  AND SEARCH AND
    5  SEIZURE;
    6    (D) CRISIS INTERVENTION AND OFFICER SAFETY;
    7    (E) IDENTIFICATION OF RESOURCES TO HOUSE ANIMALS WHILE A CRIMINAL CASE
    8  IS RESOLVED;
    9    (F) REPORT WRITING AND COURTROOM TESTIMONY;
   10    (G) DISPOSAL OF THE REMAINS OF DECEASED ANIMALS;
   11    (H) IDENTIFICATION AND NOTIFICATION OF AN ANIMAL'S OWNER; AND
   12    (I) OTHER RELEVANT PROVISIONS OF THIS CHAPTER.
   13    4. THE GOVERNING BODY OF A POLITICAL SUBDIVISION THAT APPOINTS  A  DOG
   14  CONTROL  OFFICER  WHO  FAILS TO OBTAIN CERTIFICATION WITHIN THE REQUIRED
   15  TIME SHALL TERMINATE THE APPOINTMENT.
   16    5. THE DEPARTMENT SHALL: (A) DETERMINE THE FORMAT OF THE TRAINING  AND
   17  CERTIFICATION  EXAMINATIONS,  INCLUDING  AN INTERNET-BASED FORMAT IF THE
   18  DEPARTMENT DEEMS SUCH TO BE APPROPRIATE;
   19    (B) ESTABLISH THE SCHEDULE FOR OFFERING TRAINING AND EXAMINATIONS;
   20    (C) ESTABLISH SUCH FEES AS THE DEPARTMENT DEEMS NECESSARY  FOR  TRAIN-
   21  ING, ADMISSION TO THE EXAMINATION, RE-EXAMINATION AND CERTIFICATION; AND
   22    (D) PROMULGATE RULES, REGULATIONS AND STANDARDS REGARDING THE APPLICA-
   23  TION OF THE TRAINING AND CERTIFICATION TOWARD RECERTIFICATION OR CONTIN-
   24  UING EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS.
   25    S 2. This act shall take effect July 1, 2013, provided that, effective
   26  immediately,  the addition, amendment and/or repeal of any rule or regu-
   27  lation necessary for the implementation of this  act  on  its  effective
   28  date  are  authorized and directed to be made and completed on or before
   29  such effective date.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the agriculture and markets law, in relation to training, examination and certification of dog control officers
